thread.title: Mum 'in stitches' after toddler finally pieces together train set - in shape of giant penis
thread.title_full: Mum 'in stitches' after toddler finally pieces together train set - in shape of giant penis

author: mirror
title: Mum 'in stitches' after toddler finally pieces together train set - in shape of giant penis
text:
Benjamin playing with his toy train set as his dad Graeme watches (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A mum was left in stitches when she woke to find her toddler had finally put together his favourite train set - in the shape of a giant penis. 
Despite having the set since he was two, the three-year-old had just finished making the track for the first time. 
But his mum couldn't believe what the finally design was distinctly reminiscent of. 
Monica Warren, 33, had been preparing breakfast for her two young sons when Benjamin called her in to see what he'd made. Benjamin put his train set together in the shape of a giant penis (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Monica Warren with her three-year-old toddler Benjamin (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) 
Monica, a secondary school teacher from Crieff, Perthshire, Scotland, said: "Benjamin is a massive train fan and is really into Thomas the Tank Engine. 
"He's had his train set since he was two, but every Christmas and birthday we add more to it. 
"He was quite chuffed when he had finished making the track and called me in to see it. 
"At that time in the morning, when I'm making breakfast and getting everyone ready, I didn't realise straight away what it looked like. 
"But as soon as it clicked, I couldn't stop laughing at it. I won't be telling him what it looked like. 
"I called my husband, Graeme, in to the living room to have a look as well but he didn't spot it straight away either." Benjamin's more conservative track layout (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Read More Comical moment mechanic desperately tries to stop car rolling off transporter but it all goes horribly wrong 
She said that Benjamin is absolutely train mad and only ever plays with his Thomas toys. 
"We keep trying to explain to him that it's okay to like other things as well," Monica added. 
"All the staff at work have seen the pictures and it had the whole staff room laughing." 
Monica says she enjoys reading mummy blogs that are a 'realistic depiction of what it's like to be a parent'. 
She told: "There are often precious moments but equally there are moments that make you want to bash your head in." Monica, 33, with three-year-old train fanatic Benjamin (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Read More Embarrassing dads surprise their children by twerking in hot pants and red heels on stage 
Her two sons may have less than two years between them, but the age difference can prove to be a little trying at times, especially when 17-month-old Harris wants to play with his older brother's special Thomas the Tank Engine trains. 
Monica said: "It's all go in our house. 
"I'm up at six, the boys are up at seven and we're out the door at quarter to eight. 
"The boys are getting to the point now where they are starting to play together, however Benjamin likes things done a certain way and Harris is only 17 months old. 
"It's like a demolition derby when he joins in." Like us on Facebook
